TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ToolBarOverflowPanel extends System.Windows.Controls.Panel

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> might not have enough space to show all of its items. When this happens, the items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> can be placed in the ToolBarOverflowPanel, which is specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>. For an example of how to use a ToolBarOverflowPanel in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>, see [ToolBar Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the recommended width for an overflow before items flow to the next line.
Docs.value: A double value that represents the recommended width of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you set WrapWidth to 100, the width of the overflow is 100, and all the items that can fit into an area of that size are in the main . If there is only one item, and it requires a size of 120, the toolbar width expands automatically from 100 to 120. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the WrapWidth property with a .
